thread.title: Live from court: Teenager on trial accused of stabbing Wesley Lennon to death
thread.title_full: Live from court: Teenager on trial accused of stabbing Wesley Lennon to death

author: Chris Osuh
title: Live from court: Teenager on trial accused of stabbing Wesley Lennon to death
text:
Wesley Lennon, who died after being stabbed in Salford Share 
A teenager is expected to go on trial shortly accused of murdering a man he stabbed to death in Eccles. 
Wesley Lennon, 26, also known as Wesley Barnard, died after suffering stab wounds in an incident in the Winton area in August. 
Adam Akhtar, 18, of Somerset Road, Eccles, denies murder. 15:21 Wesley ' was trying to calm things down' 
Wesley Lennon was trying to calm things down - but the aggression of the group ended up directed at him. 
Oladeinde punched Wesley, who punched back in self-defence, it was alleged. 
The two men ended up fighting on the floor, where Wesley was kicked at by Mr Trelfa and the boy, the court heard. 
Adam Akhtar, who knew the trio, was urged to hurry up by the female witness as it was ‘really kicking off’. 15:20 Fighting continued 
Mr Oladeinde was injured in the fight, causing bleeding to his nose or lip, and was pushed out of the house by the sister of the girl who had invited the trio to her home. 
There was a struggle between them and he ended up hitting her in the face. 
Wesley Lennon was visiting a neighbour, and approached Mr Oladeinde as he was allegedly shouting threats towards the house he had been pushed out of. The 16-year-old boy then came out of the fight and started fighting with Mr Oladeinde again. 
Wesley Lennon was ‘in the middle of the melee’, and Louis Trelfa also became involved in the fighting, the court heard. 15:10 Argument about money led to trouble 
The trio - Olabisi Oladeinde, then aged 19, Louis Trelfa, then 18, and a 16-year-old boy - are on trial alongside Akhtar, accused of violent disorder. 
The 16-year-old boy and Olabisi Oladeinde were at a gathering at a girl’s house at Cambrai Crescent when they began arguing about money, the court heard. 
Oladeinde is said to have punched the 16-year-old boy. 
The girl whose house it was called Adam Akhtar to the scene to help deal with the trouble. 15:06 Chris Osuh Background outlined to jury 
The background to the incident is being outlined to jurors by the prosecution. The three men involved in the fight Wesley Lennon was trying to break up were ‘intoxicated’, the jury were told. 14:58 Trial begins 
Wesley Lennon was trying to break up a fight involving three people when he was stabbed in the chest once by Mr Akhtar late on Bank Holiday Monday, prosecutor Paul Reid QC said. 
He was pronounced dead at 12.37am the next morning. Share
